required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Internet Auditory Rehabilitation: Follow-up to Adult Hearing Screening
clinical_study.official_title: Internet Auditory Rehabilitation: Innovative Follow-up to Adult Hearing Screening.

collaborator.agency: William Demant Foundation (Formerly known as the Oticon Foundation)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if a newly developed program called "I Manage my hearing loss" (iManage) will increase the number of individuals who visit an audiologist after failing a hearing screening. The iManage program will educate individuals about hearing loss, demonstrate that hearing problems are important, demonstrate that support from family and friends is important and help participants identify the benefits and concerns related to seeking help for hearing loss.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months following the failed hearing screening
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of individuals who visit an audiologist for a comprehensive hearing evaluation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on the Health Belief Questionnaire, a survey that measures attitudes about the 6 constructs of the Health Belief Model as related to seeking hearing healthcare
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (within one week of screening) and 6 months post baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Mean score (which can range between 1 and 11) on each of 6 scales: perceived susceptibility, perceived severity, perceived benefits, perceived barriers, perceived self-efficacy, and cues to action. A higher score indicates greater agreement with the construct.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on the Readiness for Change Questionnaire, a single-item questionnaire that attempts to place the participant on a continuum regarding readiness for hearing healthcare as outline by the Transtheoretical Model.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 4 weeks post baseline, and 6 months post baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will select the statement that best describes their view of their hearing status, 1 indicates "precontemplation", 2 indicates "contemplation", 3 indicates, "preparation", 4 indicates "action" on the Transtheoretical Model Continuum.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total score on the Hearing Loss Support Scale, a questionnaire that measures self-perceived informational and emotional support from family, peers, and healthcare providers about managing hearing loss.
secondary_outcome.description: Total score can range between 7 and 49, with a higher score indicating greater support from others.

other_outcome.time_frame: 3 months following the failed hearing screening
other_outcome.description: Percentage of experimental participants who begin the iManage program

other_outcome.time_frame: 3 months following the failed hearing screening
other_outcome.description: Percentage of experimental participants who complete the iManage program

other_outcome.measure: Mean scores on the Audiology Decision Making Scale, a scale designed to measure preparedness for decision making for 13 specific decision processes
other_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks after completion of iManage Program
other_outcome.description: Mean score can range between 1 and 5 with higher scores indicating greater self-perceived usefulness of the iManage Program in making a decision about hearing healthcare.

other_outcome.measure: A focus group of individuals who completed the iManage program to learn participants perceptions about the content, benefits and drawbacks of the iManage program
other_outcome.time_frame: 6 to 8 weeks after completion of iManage Program
other_outcome.description: Qualitative thematic analysis will indicate common attitudes (themes) about the iManage program

arm_group.description: Following a failed hearing screening, participants will be offered the standard of care (information sheet recommending a comprehensive hearing evaluation) and asked to complete the iManage Program. Six months after the screening participants will be asked if they visited an audiologist.

Following a failed hearing screening, participants will be offered the standard of care (information sheet recommending a comprehensive hearing evaluation). Six months after the screening participants will be asked if they visited an audiologist and they will be given the opportunity to complete the iManage Program.

intervention.description: An internet-based decision coaching guide to help an individual decide if they wish to visit an audiologist.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject must fail a hearing screening (any threshold >34 decibels hearing level at 2000 or 3000 Hertz in either ear) or show equivalent or greater degree of hearing loss on most recent audiogram.
- Free of obvious outer or middle ear disease (as measured by otoscopy)
- Between the ages of 45 and 85
- Pass a health literacy screening
- Pass a thinking skills screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Experience seeing an audiologist for a hearing evaluation or management
- Experience using a hearing aid

facility.name: University of Louisville, Program in Audiology

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no individual participant data (IPD) sharing plan at this time as this is a feasibility study.
